page.title: 09EDUCATION
page.content: To the north of the River Rodley there are no{schools}but there are some in Minsterworth and Westbury on Severn. Children in the area may go to the following schools: {Walmore Junior School, Abenhall {Secondary School}or the{Royal Forest {of Dean Grammar School.}A few go to private schools in Gloucester or Cheltenham.There is a bus service which takes the children to school every day. Secondary education in the north is being re-organised on{ {Comprehensive}lines. The same situation applies to the south of the River. Since 1983 all children have had to travel to{Primary {School}.{Secondary pupils}also have to travel (to Quedgley or Stroud). The distances children have to travel to their schools varies greatly but tends to be in the region of 3-12 miles.
